title: Australian Jock Palfreeman speaks after release from Bulgarian detention centre – video
text: Paul 'Jock' Palfreeman, who served 11 years in prison for fatally stabbing a Bulgarian student, has been released from immigration detention in the capital, Sofia, nearly a month after being granted parole. Speaking to journalists as he left the detention centre, Palfreeman voiced a desire to stay in Bulgaria if possible. 'Many people probably think, that I have had protection from Australia for the last 12 years, but the truth is, that the people who have helped me were Bulgarians and I trust them'
description: Upon his release from immigration detention in Sofia, the Australian who spent 11 years in prison for fatally stabbing a Bulgarian student says he would prefer to stay in Bulgaria
